p: CK and CKN were chosen as suitable materials for the immobilization of P. stutzeri. The cells adsorbed on CK and CKN were 1.0 × 10 9 and 6.6 × 10 8 UFC·g −1, respectively (biomaterials). The results of this investigation are in accordance with other reports [ 40]. The SEM micrographs confirmed biomaterial formation, as shown in Figure 5. The presence of P. stutzeri on the materials was evidenced by the formation of a continuous layer (biofilm) that was absent in CK materials.
